body: thanks @maosongfu. The AckingTopology is not a good example, I will add ExclamationTopology to the starting guide.
Fixed in #268
@maosongfu @ashvina made a comment about whether we can use the Hadoop API as opposed to using command line tool.
This looks good to me!

Karthik:
as I am loading the workspace, i see a few conflicts that otherwise doesnt
showup in compile;

for ex: there are two AuroraLauncher (com.twitter.heron.scheduler.aurora)
one in
heron-master/heron/_scheduler_/src/java/com/twitter/heron/scheduler/aurora
and other in
heron-master/heron/_schedulers_
/src/java/com/twitter/heron/scheduler/aurora/AuroraLauncher.java

one of the AuroraLaunchers refers to packages that dont seem to be in any
workspace. Any clues?
import com.twitter.heron.scheduler.util.NetworkUtility;

@prabhuinbarajan - 

heron/scheduler is the old code which will be removed as we move to newscheduler, once we finish testing with Aurora.

heron/schedulers is the new code that are specific to each scheduler
heron/newscheduler is the abstract scheduler that invokes scheduler specific code

bazel will not build anything in heron/scheduler, the old code, since it does not have any BUILD file.

Added you to the slack account
@ashvina - this classpath is mainly to run Launcher and Uploader on the cli. This does not have to passed all the way to the sandbox, isn't?
Yes. The classpath configuration is for adding hadoop jars at runtime on the cli. The intention is to avoid packaging the jars with Heron distribution.
working on it - should have a PR in 30 minutes!
PR is at https://github.com/twitter/heron/pull/272 - note that i have not added a validation whether the classpath value is valid - working on it.
@ashvina - yes after our meeting @maosongfu figured out this and we are working on a fix - so that it is set in `LaunchRunner``rather than in the implementation of``ILaunch```.

Hi,
Let's understand the problems clearly first and then design the solution.
1. Should we provide "Ability to configure client classpath"?
   I think so, as @ashvina mentioned the issue. We need to provide a way to specify extra classpath for running scheduler.
2. Is this classpath used only on client side?
   @ashvina said yes, but I want to confirm with this. Implementation of IScheduler (In your case, the driver or application master part)will run on server side; does the classpath also need to be specified for the Implementation of IScheduler too? If so, current #272 is not enough; Launcher needs to get this classpath to correctly construct the command to start SchedulerMain, i.e. correctly set the value of classpath for SchedulerMain.
3. How to provide "Ability to configure client classpath"?
   #272 gets classpath argument from cli and pass it to execute java_class. 
   It is not a good solution: it requires people to specify this classpath every time they submit a topology, which is unneeded and annoying.
   We should provide a config for extra_scheduler_class, (in this case, the default value can be hadoop related jars) and cli will pick up this config when trying to run scheduler related JVM process. Also, we can also provide --classpath option to override the default value to provide more flexibility.
4. When providing an option to override the value, I don't think "-classpath" is a good name, since topology developers can also set additional classpath for their topologies instances in topology Config; the name "classpath" causes confusion. "scheduler_classpath" can be a better one; or any other good names eliminating confusion with classpath for topology instances.
5. A small implementation question on #272 
   why add one more argument in method execute.heron_class(..), rather than directly pass the value to arguments "extra_jars"? (Will point it out in the PR too.)

My answers are - 

for 2) @ashvina confirmed that is only being on the cli side. 

for 3) the bigger picture is the use of heronrc or user specified heronrc. Such situations occur even in other programs such as bazel etc (where the same argument is needed for multiple invocations). There is issue outstanding to do it - https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/138, this will be fixed in a different PR.

for 4) scheduler_classpath is probably not apt, something like cli-classpath might be more relevant. Another question is how the topology config class path is provided when invoking the cli that you think will cause confusion?

for 5) we can do extra_jars as well - but I wanted to be consistent in ensuring that the user provided classpath is always the first.

2) I am curious how to make it happen LOL, since in earlier MesosScheduler, I hard-coded the classpath to construct the SchedulerMain command.

3) then #138 should be the correct solution for this issue. #272 seems hacky and not good. Furthermore, #272 does not seem to prepare for #138; it is not extensible and may need to be 90% rewritten when doing the #138 

4) topology developers can suppose they can also set the classpath to start instances in cli via --classpath option.

for 3) we need both #272 and #138 - sometimes, people want to give in the command line just to override. This is a common practice typically in the Unix world - it will be better to go some existing convention and practice.

for 4) if we just have one single classpath at the cli - both submission and topology development will it be clean?

3) I agree we need to provide config option to override the value. I just doubt whether the change in #272 is easy for future maintenence or extensibility.

4) topology developers will still get confused. Let's figure out a better option name than --classpath.

3) when #138 is implemented cli will read .heronrc and it will be the defaults and if any command line is provided it will override the defaults. Either override or the defaults (depending on what is provided) will be passed on to the implementation of #272 

4) I am open for a different name as well - as long as it is simple and easy to remember
This looks awesome, I  was able to try it out and it looks like it setup the project perfectly.

One thing i did notice is that `heron/config/src` is missing from the source list. This contains some configuration yaml files which I'm guessing are not picked up when generating the source paths. They would be handy to add so that they come up in the omnisearch bar.
shipit
Fixed in #275
Thanks @prabhuinbarajan - if you could take care of this and sent a PR, it will be great!

Other concerns;
1. w.r.t #138.

According to the description, "“.heronrc” is a simple configuration file to support repeated overriding options, instead of typing those options", I don't think it is a suitable place to save the default value of --scheduler-classpath option, since this value varies basing on different scheduler, rather than varies basing on different users. For instance, yarn-scheduler requires hadoop jar in classpath while mesos-scheduler requires mesos jar. “.heronrc” is designed to save something like “role” or repeated overriding options basing on a particular user.

Furthermore, I doubt the idea to have ““.heronrc””:
1) “.heronrc” can reduce repeated overriding options. But then the overriding options will be spitted into 2 parts: one part is in “.heronrc” while another one is in command line. It makes debug harder.
2) I also doubt whether “.heronrc” does reduce repeated overriding options a lot. 
- Practically, people have a script (or copy-parse the command) to invoke heron-cli; they don’t have to type the repeated options again and again.
- There are very few options fitting with “.heronrc”; most of them should be taken care by heron/config. I doubt the need to add one extra file.

2.
@ashvina When we run client side’s scheduler code (Launcher, Uploader or RuntimeManager), we “$HERON_HOME/lib/scheduler” and” $HERON_HOME/lib/uploader” into the classpath (we do something similar when running IScheduler on sever side). One possible workaround is to build a fat jar including necessary dependencies and put it under lib/scheduler folder. What do you think of this workaround?
tx can you also do similar things in killAuroraJob() and restartAuroraJob()

Prabhu - just one comment, instead of changing the directory structure, can we change the package itself? In `LaunchRunnerTest.java` you could change the package name to 
`import com.twitter.heron.scheduler` instead of  `import com.twitter.heron.scheduler.service`. We are not going to have service there.

@ashvina - currently all scheduler jars are prebuilt and shipped when you run heron-client-install.sh. With hadoop it is possible that packaged version might not be the right version since hadoop environments defer. Yes this approach requires adding jars to git only if it needed for linking and packing. If you are invoking command line programs, the jars are not needed.

Definitely this approach might not be ideal solution - since internally we have only a very few schedulers. There are pros and cons for this solution - 

PROS  include fixes the version of the jar used, self contained and does not require installing other packages

CONS are version mismatch, fat heron-client-install (even for schedulers that you might not be using).
shipit
This is expected behavior, probably should add some docs to make it clear just in case people put files there.
LGTM, merging
Merging. Not waiting for Travis since its just docs being changed.

These "exception logging" are expected rather than "real exception", as you see we kill the topology successfully. May compress them into DEBUG log rather than INFO log, or to log more helpful information.

This looks good to me. I ran `rm *.iml; rm -rf .idea` and then ran the setup script and it looks like it set everything up correctly.

It looks like you have a few lines commented out in `scripts/setup-intellij.sh` that could be cleaned up but other than that I think this looks good.

Edit: Would it be possible to add the 3rd party folder as well?
Thanks for doing this. Merging.
Also commented out some things in release/BUILD that are breaking things. @kramasamy is that entire BUILD going away?

Bill,
A lot of this was baselined from the bazel setup intellij reference script which helps setup the intellij workspace for the bazel source code to help get quickly running.  This initially seemed to be of purely utility value .
I agree with these comments,  and can make changes based on how strongly we feel about them.

@ajorgensen - will include the cleanup and include third party folder as a module.
@billonahill  - will research on ipr structure , and get that included.
@kramasamy  - the verification instructions are quite manual at this point.
git clone <heron>
cd scripts
./setup-intellij.sh
open up the heron folder in intellij and it would open two modules (python , and java). 

Thanks
prabhu
@billonahill - release/BUILD file is going away. In fact that entire directory will be gone.
Instead of language based modules, what do folks think about functional-based modules? Like one for core, cli, tools, etc?

i like the functional modules. I just dont feel competent enough to comment on the domain specific organization as I am not deeply familiar with a heron codebase. Deferring to the group for advice. 
My only comment on such an organization is it would be preferable  if the script can discover this. we may both agree that expressly listing each of these (like core, cli etc) may not be completely optimal.
@kramasamy I updated the spacing, let me know if there are any other style guide violations.

Right we'd want a way to discover all the parts of the functional modules. They could be api, client, core, tools, which are the 4 build artifacts produced by bazel. Or they could be the lower level packages:

```
ls bazel-bin/heron/
api          cli2         controller   executor     localmode    newscheduler proto        shell        statemgrs    storm        tracker      uploaders
cli          common       examples     instance     metricsmgr   packing      schedulers   spi          stmgr        tmaster      ui
```

@kramasamy do you know how to do a `bazel query` command for all deps of each of those?
@billonahill - from a functionality standpoint, there is no clear separation. For example, scheduler jars go both into client and core. In such cases, what value does the functional separation add?

@kramasamy maybe it's better than to not use client, core but instead to break out by logical grouping like what we see in `ls bazel-bin/heron`. The benefit is that when working in a functional area you can see both the python, java, bash, perl, etc. parts together as part of the same client module, which might share higher level build targets. Splitting up by language fragments the logical groupings of the project.

one other consideration - intellij does require you to group them under modules that come with specific capabilities . if you look at the IML today , each module has to be declared as java or python or one listed below.
https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/2016.1/supported-module-types.html?origin=old_help
@billonahill - thanks. @prabhuinbarajan - it look like functional modules are nice to think about - seems to have an advantage. It will be great if you could accommodate this.
I added a few comments, please let me know if they make sense or need more clarification
Tests done.

Fixes: #263

bazel_configure.py should be self contained. If it depends on packages then the user has to install those packages. If the semvar.py is just one file, can we include it in bazel_configure.py. This could be temporary since newer versions of bazel has support for auto detection.

For detecting gcc and g++ version, typically you could use gcc --version (in all platforms) and the output could be parsed to get the appropriate value. Similarly for cpp/ld etc. For compiling in other platforms, we use docker. Check the top level docker directory.

@ashvina - While most of the proposal sounds fine, I would suggest not to copy the hadoop jars into $(HERON_HOME)/lib/scheduler. It is possible that Heron might be installed in a system directory such as /usr/local/heron - which might not have permission to copy.  Instead, if we could include the HADOOP_CLASSPATH to be in the classpath in the CLI (interally), probably it might be easier. Let me check with the team tomorrow and make a concrete proposal.

@kramasamy the user doesn't need to install semver since it's committed in the repo and referenced directly via it's path.

Do we have any docs for how we launch instances on Docker? What's in `docker/` is just how we build. What I need to know is what the output of `gcc --version` looks like on each platform, since the parsing logic will be different. It's very different between OSx and rhel5 for example.
Delete the comments, then shipit 👍

The script is working and has failed travis CI due to a too low version:

`FAILED:  /usr/bin/gcc-4.8 is version 4.8.1 which is less than the required version 4.8.2`
https://travis-ci.com/twitter/heron/builds/23718358#L2169

Either the CI host is non-compliant or our min version for gcc of 4.8.2 is too strict.

@kramasamy  , @billonahill  - spent a good part of yesterday and today determining the feasibility of functional modules. it looks promising , but i am running into a few glitches that i am hoping you could help.

given the shared nature of dependencies - it seems the separation is not clear. You mentioned it already. i am just catching up to your comments friday. 

`def heron_core_lib_statemgr_files():
    return [
        "//heron/statemgrs/src/java:heron-localfs-statemgr",
        "//heron/statemgrs/src/java:heron-zookeeper-statemgr",
    ]`
and 
`def heron_client_lib_uploader_files():
    return [
        "//heron/uploaders/src/java:heron-null-uploader",
        "//heron/uploaders/src/java:heron-localfs-uploader",
        "//heron/uploaders/src/java:heron-hdfs-uploader",
    ]`, 

Having said that , the proposal is as follows:

if we are comfortable with the groups under bazel-bin/heron:
ls bazel-bin/heron:
api  cli  cli2  common  controller  examples  executor  instance  localmode  metricsmgr  newscheduler  packing  proto  schedulers  shell  spi  statemgrs  stmgr  storm  tmaster  tracker  ui  uploaders

then this is pretty much what we currently have under MODULE heron-java/heron. I may have found a way of enabling a single module to be poly-glot and support python , java and C++.

with this , there will be a single module  - heron , with multiple content roots (based on bazel-bin/heron) + (3rd party). Please advice.

Thanks
prabhu
that sounds reasonable to me @prabhuinbarajan
thanks, i will proceed down this path.

+1

Maven has a plugin to enforce license headers on all source files.
http://code.mycila.com/license-maven-plugin/

If such a thing exists for bazel we should use it.
Related comment in #320

Also, there's a lot of text describing commands in this doc that should probably be thinned out and moved into the cli usage:
https://github.com/twitter/heron/blob/master/website/content/docs/operators/heron-cli.md

And these usage examples in that doc don't seem correct, since they have what should be optional overrides shown as required preceding the required topology.

```
$ heron-cli activate <activator-overrides> <topology>
$ heron-cli deactivate <deactivator-overrides> <topology>
$ heron-cli restart <restarter-overrides> <topology> [shard]
$ heron-cli kill <killer-overrides> <topology>
```

That page also shows invalid `version` and `classpath` commands:

```
$ ~/bin/heron-cli3 version
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.000s.
$ ~/bin/heron-cli3 --version
usage: heron-cli3 <command> <options> ...
heron-cli3: error: too few arguments
$ ~/bin/heron-cli3 classpath
usage: heron-cli3 <command> <options> ...
heron-cli3: error: argument <command> <options>: invalid choice: 'classpath' (choose from 'activate', 'deactivate', 'help', 'kill', 'ps', 'restart', 'submit', 'version')
```
Related issue #321 for clean-up in client usage and cli docs.
@billonahill - I checked with hazel and it does not see to have a plugin for it. Not sure how to enforce it in bazel.

@kramasamy I moved semver to 3rdparty. We've got `*.pyc` in `.gitignore` so those won't be committed. I added that to `docker/.tarignore` as well.

What about the Travis CI version of gcc (see my comment above). Should we downgrade the required version to 4.8.1 or upgrade travis to 4.8.2?
